sections.title: What is the Menstrual Cycle?
sections.content: The menstrual cycle is a natural, yet intricate sequence of hormonal and physiological changes that a person’s body undergoes every month in preparation for the possibility of pregnancy. It is regulated primarily by fluctuations in hormone levels, especially estrogen and progesterone, which trigger the different phases of the cycle.

sections.title: Phases of the Menstrual Cycle
sections.content: The menstrual cycle consists of four distinct phases that repeat roughly every month, preparing the body for the possibility of pregnancy. These phases are regulated by a balance of hormones, and each has a specific role in the reproductive process.

sections.title: When to See Your Doctor
